summary: An Ordinance appropriating the sum of Two Hundred Fifty Dollars ($250) out of the General Fund of The City of Seattle to pay the claim of M. A. Frost for personal injuries received by Martha Frost, wife of claimant, by falling through a hole in the sidewalk on the north side of Holly Street in The City of Seattle about one hundred fifty (150) feet east of the S. R. S. Railway tract, on the evening of the first day of October, 1910, and authorizing the drawing of a warrant therefor.
